moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4: As a man of honor, Anderssen must accept the gambit!
moves.3. Bc4 Qh4+: Anderssen attacks at once, forcing Harrwitz' monarch to bestir himself.
moves.4. Kf1 Bc5: Only move 4, and already Anderssen threatens 5... Q-B7 mate!
moves.5. d4: Harrwitz not only cuts off the Bishop, he opens lines for his own attack.
moves.12. exf6 gxf6: Thinking the Bishop must retreat. But...
moves.13. Ne5: Harrwitz proceeds with the attack against Anderssen's denuded K-side.
moves.13... O-O: This doesn't help, but Anderssen's real problem his his useless Q-side pieces.
moves.14. Qxh5: Bringing the powerful Queen to bear on Black's helpless King.
moves.14... fxg5+: 14... PxN dis ch is equally bad. With 4 pieces assaulting his K, Anderssen is in big trouble.
moves.15. Nf6+: This double check forces mate in 2.
moves.15... Kg7: 15... K-R1 ends the game a move sooner [16 QxP mate].
moves.17. Ng4#: A smashing attacking game by Harrwitz.
